With all due respect to old Elm St. movies with Englund (which were scaring me shitless when i was a kid), this remake can imo proudly carry the name of the franchise. Good short story (cutting to the core), some decent acting (something you dont come across very often these days) and some tasty white meat (no pun intended). All in all, big surprise (for me at least) since in the last decade good horror remakes have been few and far between. Gratz to all the crew involved. Deserves much bigger rating that the IMDB gave it. Jack E. Haley kicks ass as Freddy. Oh, and this release: A10 V10 And to all you who shit on this movie... sweet dreams tonight...

Are you out of your fucking mind? This version is nothing like he old ones.. Exactly 20:00 minutes into the movie hes in a girls dreams inching his way to her while she is just standing there. He has no emotion whatsoever, just a terrifying voice as hes just inching his way to her step by step. M. Night Shamylan on the other hand in the older freddies, embued a feeling of confusion amongst his victims throught a kind of imaginative comedy he and still maintained that level of fear, with that motivation there, Robert Englund kicked ass! He made it as if it were a really crazy, funny, scary dream. This new guy  has no other emotion besides scary. Now you are seriously mistaken when you say this crap is just as good as the Nightmare on elm streets with John Englund. This movie is a shame to what the entire franchise stood for, and shouldn't even bear that title. 

And as for the director, Samuel Bayer, he has never even done serious screenplay before this movie, only music videos and music documentaries and shit. So who the fuck is he? Nobody. Hell, Rob Zombie could've done better if you wanted scary.

What we got here is (One of the biggest) abominations in movie history. Anyone who downloaded it here is right to do so, because this shit is not worth the money.
